name: time_synchronization_issues_causing_spark_job_failures
description: This incident type refers to issues encountered in a Spark cluster where Spark jobs are failing due to time synchronization problems between the nodes in the cluster. These synchronization issues can cause data inconsistencies and errors in Spark applications, which can lead to job failures. To resolve this issue, it is necessary to ensure that all nodes in the cluster have synchronized time.

cells.name: cell_1
cells.content:
## Time synchronization issues causing Spark job failures.
This incident type refers to issues encountered in a Spark cluster where Spark jobs are failing due to time synchronization problems between the nodes in the cluster. These synchronization issues can cause data inconsistencies and errors in Spark applications, which can lead to job failures. To resolve this issue, it is necessary to ensure that all nodes in the cluster have synchronized time.

cells.name: cell_2
cells.content: ## Check the time on each node in the Spark cluster

cells.name: cell_3
cells.content: (host | host_name=$HOST_NAME) union (pod | k8s_cluster_name=$K8S_CLUSTER_NAME | namespace=$NAMESPACE) | `for node in ${LIST_OF_CLUSTER_NODES}; do ssh $node date; done`

cells.name: cell_4
cells.content: ## Check the time synchronization status of each node in the cluster

cells.name: cell_5
cells.content: (host | host_name=$HOST_NAME) union (pod | k8s_cluster_name=$K8S_CLUSTER_NAME | namespace=$NAMESPACE) | `for node in ${LIST_OF_CLUSTER_NODES}; do ssh $node timedatectl status; done`

cells.name: cell_6
cells.content: ## Check the NTP daemon status on each node in the cluster

cells.name: cell_7
cells.content: (host | host_name=$HOST_NAME) union (pod | k8s_cluster_name=$K8S_CLUSTER_NAME | namespace=$NAMESPACE) | `for node in ${LIST_OF_CLUSTER_NODES}; do ssh $node systemctl status ntpd; done`

cells.name: cell_8
cells.content: ## Check the NTP daemon configuration on each node in the cluster

cells.name: cell_9
cells.content: (host | host_name=$HOST_NAME) union (pod | k8s_cluster_name=$K8S_CLUSTER_NAME | namespace=$NAMESPACE) | `for node in ${LIST_OF_CLUSTER_NODES}; do ssh $node cat /etc/ntp.conf; done`

cells.name: cell_10
cells.content: ## Restart the NTP daemon on each node in the cluster

cells.name: cell_11
cells.content: (host | host_name=$HOST_NAME) union (pod | k8s_cluster_name=$K8S_CLUSTER_NAME | namespace=$NAMESPACE) | `for node in ${LIST_OF_CLUSTER_NODES}; do ssh $node systemctl restart ntpd; done`

cells.name: cell_12
cells.content: ## Check the time synchronization status again after restarting the NTP daemon

cells.name: cell_13
cells.content: (host | host_name=$HOST_NAME) union (pod | k8s_cluster_name=$K8S_CLUSTER_NAME | namespace=$NAMESPACE) | `for node in ${LIST_OF_CLUSTER_NODES}; do ssh $node timedatectl status; done`

cells.name: cell_14
cells.content: ## Incorrect NTP (Network Time Protocol) server configuration on one or more nodes in the cluster.

cells.name: cell_16
cells.content: ## Configure NTP (Network Time Protocol) on all nodes in the Spark cluster to ensure that time synchronization is consistent across all nodes.
